verses.text: 亞撒在位第三十六年，以色列王巴沙上來攻打猶大，修築拉瑪，不許人離開或進入猶大王亞撒的國境。

words.note: Directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker.

verses.text: 於是亞撒從耶和華的殿和王宮的庫房裡取出金銀來，送給住在大馬士革的亞蘭王便．哈達，說：

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Functions as a locative suffix or preposition.
Indicates movement towards the speaker or completion of an action.

verses.text: 「你父親和我父親曾經立約，你和我也要立約。現在我把金銀送給你，請你去廢除你和以色列王巴沙訂立的約，好使他離開我而去。」

words.note: Introduces a direct object that is acted upon.
Connects clauses, often indicating a consequence or subsequent action.

verses.text: 便．哈達聽從了亞撒王的話，就派遣他屬下的眾軍長去攻擊以色列的城市，他們攻陷了以雲、但、亞伯．瑪音和拿弗他利一切貯藏貨物的城市。

words.note: Used as a prefix to indicate plurality or a group.

verses.text: 巴沙聽見了，就停止修築拉瑪，把工程都停止了。

words.note: Resultative complement, meaning 'to hear successfully'.
Introduces a direct object that is acted upon.

verses.text: 於是亞撒王帶領猶大眾人，把巴沙修築拉瑪所用的石頭和木材都搬走，用來修築迦巴和米斯巴。

words.note: Used to form a nominalized phrase indicating 'that which is done'

words.definition: used for, for the purpose of

verses.text: 那時，先見哈拿尼來見猶大王亞撒，對他說：「因你倚靠亞蘭王，沒有倚靠耶和華你的 神，所以亞蘭王的軍隊才可以脫離你的手。

words.note: Lit. 'fore-seer'
The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.
The preceding space often indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 古實人和路比人不是有強大的軍隊嗎？戰車和馬兵不是極多嗎？只因你倚靠耶和華，耶和華就把他們交在你手裡。

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.
The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.

verses.text: 耶和華的眼目遍察全地，一心歸向他的，他必以大能扶助他們；你作這事太愚昧了。從今以後，你必常有戰爭。」

words.note: The Hebrew Tetragrammaton YHWH, transliterated.
Often used figuratively in religious texts for God's watchful gaze.

verses.text: 於是亞撒對先見發怒，把他囚在監裡，因為亞撒為了這事很惱怒他。同時亞撒也壓迫人民。

words.note: Lit. 'fore-seer'

verses.text: 亞撒所行的事蹟，一生的始末，都記在猶大和以色列諸王記上。

words.note: Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings).
Turns a verb into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which was done'.
Literally 'all kings'.
Used as part of a book title, e.g., 'Chronicles'.
Indicates 'book of' or 'volume one'.

verses.heading: Asa’s Reign Ends

verses.text: 亞撒在位第三十九年，患了腳病，病情嚴重；可是，連他患病的時候，也沒有尋求耶和華，只管尋求醫生。

words.note: Literally 'at position'.
Implies 'only concerned himself with'.

verses.text: 亞撒作王四十一年以後死了，和他的列祖同睡。

words.note: A common biblical euphemism for death.
Biblical euphemism for dying and being buried with ancestors.

verses.text: 人把他埋葬在大衛城裡他為自己所鑿的墳墓中。他們把他放在堆滿按著作香的方法調和的各樣香料的床上，又為他燒了很多香料。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Turns a verb into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which was carved'.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Literally 'make fragrance'.
